properties.space: This is a large 2 Bedroom apartment that is newly renovated, brand new air conditioners in each room and in a great location 2 minutes from Central. Everything you would need with high speed internet, wifi, Cable TV, DVD Player, Flat screen LCD TV, a full kitchen with microwave, stove and electric cooker, and refrigerator. There's a full bath with shower. It is on the top floor of the building and there are 2 working elevators.  In the area, you will find banks, bus stops, tram stops, subway stops, supermarkets, convenient stores and laundry mats all within walking distance from the building.  There are double beds in each bed room and a double pullout sofa bed in the living room. Therefore if 2 people share each of the beds, then the apartment could comfortably accommodate up to 6 people. It's within walking distance to well know night life districts so don't miss out on SOHO and LKF.  **In the past I have borrowed out adapters for FREE to guests as a courtesy and convenience, however

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Sheung Wan neighbourhood is ever changing and a fantastic mix of "old' and "new" Hong Kong.  This apartment is located in the heart of Hong Kong's commercial, cultural and shopping districts and within short walking distance to the subway and HK Macau Ferry Pier.  A few minutes walk away from the harbour front and the fantastic Sun Yat Sun Memorial Park and Public swimming pool over look the world famous Victoria Harbor.
properties.notes: Once you arrive in Hong Kong, everything is quite simple and all starts with a call from the FREE phones at the airport located in the hall immediately after you pass through baggage customs.  There is also a Visitors Center there if you would like to pick up some maps, local travel guides, etc. to read on your way to the apartment.  If you need a local SIM card, there is a 7-11 in the middle section  of the main arrival hall where they see all types of SIM cards, I usually prefer the PCCW brand as it is the larges local operator.
properties.transit: The Sheung Wan MTR station is but 8 min walking distance away that takes you all over Hong Kong and Kowloon.  There are also buses, trams, minibuses that run near the doorstep of the building on Des Voeux Road West Road and take you to every corner of the island and beyond.
properties.access: Guests have access to: - FREE WiFi - Cable TV - Hair Dryer - Iron/Ironing Board - Microwave, Hot Water Boiler, Cooker - Towels, Sheets, Toilet Paper, Shampoo, Soap, etc.
properties.interaction: As much as possible or invisible if you want. I will try to meet with arriving guests and show them the area.  Whenever guests need information or recommendations, I am always available via messaging or phone.
properties.house_rules: This is a Strictly NON SMOKING Flat. UPON ARRIVAL AT PROPERTY, ALL GUESTS MUST WAIT FOR ME AT THE FRONT GATE OUTSIDE OF THE BUILDING.  BUILDING RESIDENTS WILL COMPLAIN TO PROPERTY MANAGEMENT IF THE LOBBY AREA INSIDE BUILDING IS BLOCKED.  THANKS FOR YOUR KIND UNDERSTANDING FOR AN ENJOYABLE STAY. Check in time is AFTER 12:30 pm.  Make sure to contact us by phone at least 30 minutes prior to arrival such that we can meet you at the flat to hand you the keys and acquaint you to the surroundings.  As this is a family business, please try your best to arrive at the apartment as early as possible. After 11:30pm as transport to the apartment is limited for us, we have to charge HKD150 to cover our taxi transport cost to and from the apartment. We are generally exhausted at the end of the day and we really would rather you arrive early and not have to charge this. Guests must wait for us OUTSIDE the building upon arrival and not enter the building without us as this causes unnecessary misunders
properties.host_about: I was born in California and raised in Hong Kong. Went to college in the states and returned to Hong Kong a few years ago.  I absolutely love travelling around the region but Hong Kong has always welcomed me home and I look forward to showing off my home town and sharing all the little insights and local specialities with all my guests!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Sai Ying Pun is an exciting, up-and-coming district on Hong Kong Island. The street is very special with a lot of character, with a beautiful hospital-turned-community centre built in 1892, a quaint brick house and a sports ground.  Life is easy here, with plenty of good retaurants (French, Italian, Thai, Japanese, Spanish, Cantonese, etc), convenience stores, grocery shops, supermarkets and a wet market! An escalator has been installed not long ago, making life even easier and the neighbourhood livelier. Just a 30-second ride and you will be transported up to the Mid-Levels, where there are banks, laundry shops, and more restaurants.  The neighbourhood is an interesting mix of people: urbane types, young professionals, expats from different parts of the world, and laid-back and friendly elderly people.
properties.notes: 1. Rent covers all utilities (wifi connection, water, gas and electricity).  2. A house manual will be sent to you once a booking is made. It contains all the essential info on the flat (e.g. wifi password et al).
properties.transit: Walk one street up and you will reach Sai Ying Pun metro station! It takes you just a few minutes on the underground train to get to Central.  There are also plenty of buses and minibuses going to Admiralty, Wan Chai, North Point, etc. You can also easily walk down to Hollywood via a stairway that is about 7 minutes away.
properties.access: - Fully furnished with everything you need for a pleasant stay: free wifi, queen-sized bed, washing machine, 3-seat sofa, dining table that can be unfolded to seat 6, TV, DVD player, hi-fi, radio, ceiling fan, easel that doubles as a music stand, air-con, foot massage machine, and even a planetarium for star gazing!  - The well equipped kitchen comes with coffee maker, toaster, blender, washer, kettle, rice cooker, fridge & freezer and more.  - Various stylish lights to create different ambiences. - Table-tennis table in the backyard of the residential complex.
properties.house_rules: Before you make a booking, please kindly write to check availability and briefly introduce yourself and your purpose of visiting Hong Kong. Thanks a lot! 2. Sorry but no pet, no children. No smoking. No shoes inside the flat. Thank you! 3. This is a clean place. Please leave it the way it is when you check in. Thanks! 4. In case of any damage made to the typewriter or the light (or both) on the chest of drawers in the bedroom during a guest's stay, the entire deposit of HK5,000 placed by the guest will be forfeited. An unlikely scenario so long as you leave the two items alone. Much obliged.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Sai Ying Pun (or Western Camp, where the early British Military stayed) is both one of the oldest neighborhoods and trendiest up-and-coming locales on the island. With its tree lined streets, art galleries, cafes, wet markets, and countless western and local restaurants, Sai Ying Pun is an ever evolving and colorful mix of tradition and contemporary spaces.

properties.host_about:
My TAO ... It's all about ...  
Lifestyle.Living.Design.

Come and experience Hong Kong like it's your second home.  
Instinctively, as a seasoned traveler myself, I know how to fill the needs of fellow travelers. A HOME AWAY FROM HOME.

TAO had been a very exclusive brand name in the long term luxury property rental business in Hongkong & Asia. Since  Hongkong has an increasing demand on the nightly rental & short term lease & with soaring prices to boot, TAO had chosen to  share a number of it's well designed spaces with the emergence of a new breed of savvy  "travelers-on-a- budget" as inspiration.

TAO is a lifestyle team conceptualised, owned  and spearheaded by myself, a dynamic and upwardly mobile design visionary. A world class  hotelier in my old life and owner of multi homes. Always a home-lover whose goal  is to  create a restful cocoon for others.  Being aware of  how exciting yet daunting it can be to travel to a foreign land  and knowing the costs of comfort can prove to be astronomical these days, TAO  aims to answer accommodation needs by giving the best hospitality on a 1-star budget!

COMFORT &  LOCATION is  TAO's strength and giving the BEST HOSPITALITY ON A BUDGET is it's driving force!

Choose from a SELECTION OF PROPERTIES which the highest premium  is put on privacy & design. Share the various dwellings & experience the many facets of Hongkong--be that on the heart of the vibrant city, on the posh luxurious  beach suburbs  of  southside Hongkong, or on the quaint countryside of Sai Kung, New Territories.

The TAO team and myself can communicate in English, Italian and Pilipino.

Give us a shout and let's start chatting!

Safe travels,
Jeni Compagnon
Director . TAO Limited

properties.notes: The hanging plants are self watering (on a timer) so guests can enjoy them happily during their stay. The manta is to relax and enjoy, Hong Kong is a busy city so let this flat be a little oasis to enjoy in when away from the vibrant city life.
properties.transit: Travelling in HK is very convenient and High Street is no different. properties.name: Cozy Wan Chai studio
properties.space: My flat is situated on Hong Kong Island in a perfect location for sightseeing or business. It is conveniently near shops, bars, and tourist attractions.  I want to make my place available for individuals who are looking for a cost friendly place to stay in the heart of Hong Kong Island. My flat is well maintained and offers the basic necessities. It is conveniently located on the main road, Hennessey Road, in between Wan Chai (Lockhart Road bars, restaurants and night life) and Causeway Bay (Times Square, Sogo, Happy Valley Race course). My flat may be small compared to Western standards, but enough space for one person to stay comfortably. Possibility for a couple if you like to squeeze. The flat is on the 9th floor, when you enter the building there will be about 15 small steps to walk up and then you can take the lift. There is a main gate, a floor gate and a room door.    The flat includes: ¥A double bed (4' X 6') smaller than Western standard ¥Fresh bedding and pillows ¥Fresh towe

properties.neighborhood_overview: Heart of Central but escape from the noise! TIPS I can provide you with hot tips for HK sightseeing which will be in a pack ready for your arrival. This will include an MTR map, top attractions, some useful tips and phrases, exchange rates, locations of useful places like banks, ATMs, police station, hospital, beaches, money exchange, good bars, restaurants, hikes, watersports, theme parks, paintballing, discounted offers, temples etc. if you have any questions please feel free to message me before you arrive!
properties.notes: GECKOS I have 2 small crested geckos who are in a locked tank. They eat fruit paste not insects and wont bother guests at all! I always ask my guests if you would mind feeding my geckos while you stay. It is very simple (fruit powder and water) and only needs to be done every other day / alternative days.  It is not a problem at all if you don't want to do this, but I will have a friend visit the flat to do this every other day during your stay. This takes no more than 5 minutes.  To date, noone has said no and all have said it is very easy!

I offer this apartment as a non-smoking flat and if another guest checks in after you and it smells like smoke this costs me poor reviews, potential refunds and even cancellations. Theres is a standard HK500 fine for smoking in the flat which will be deducted from your deposit if you break this important rule. This means the bathroom as well! Please respect the neighbours! properties.host_about:
" Be the change you want to see in the world"  has always been my motto.

I considered myself very lucky to have stayed in a wonderful guesthouse as my first not-staying-in-hotel experience, and ever since that trip, I've been wanting to do the same to the travelers around the world. 

I've always been a good cook, a good party host and the one that people turn to when they need advices. Being a host is one of the happiest jobs on earth to me. :) 

My style of traveling is all about EXPERIENCING the destination.

Food Market - 
The easiest way is to dive in to their local markets, to see what they eat, how do they interact with each other, what do they eat for breakfast...etc.   

Old neighborhoods - 
And also I enjoy walking in the neighborhoods that is away from the crowd, where we can always see the older buildings, wrinkled faces and kittens. :)   

Night Life - 
 And never skip the night life, I enjoy watching people interact with each others in bars.

Hike - 
The best way to see the outline of the city with fresh air and sunshine :) 

Pampering - 
One of the best way to understand the local standards of good customer services is to visit a few "star-rated" SPA / Hotel SPA, you might think they are the same around the world, you would be surprised by the styles of hospitality around the world, they are the same, but different. :) 

The 5 things that I can't live without: 
Water, Moisturizer, Hugs, Good reads and dreams :)

properties.summary: Within 5 min walk of the Hong Kong University Campus & located nicely in the city with easy public transport available to get all over Hong Kong.  This 2 bedroom is the perfect base to stay, rest and then head out to have fun in the city.
properties.space: A great offer for this fabulous location near mid levels.  This 2 bedroom flat offers a large comfy double bed in each room, FREE Wifi, hair dryer, large LCD TV with entertainment DVD system.  The building has an elevator direct to the apartment with just a few steps to the lobby area. Located on High Street in a laid back area and has rapidly become a hip area hosting many of the city's most creative types, it takes 8 minutes/5 USD cab ride or 15 minutes by foot to Central. There is a 7-11 convenience store just across the street.  The area is a melting pot of East meets West, with older chinese traditional buildings being surrounded by high end new luxurious developments with new restaurants, nice coffee shops, banking, shops popping up all the time. Transport is very easy through the nearby tram, buses and minibuses.  Of course, the taxis in Hong Kong are most convenient and very cheap compared to other big cities like New York and London.

Getting around The apartment is very close to Hong Kong University HKU so the transport in and out of the area is super convenient, with the easiest being the many buses and mini buses that whisk students and residents around all parts of Hong Kong. There is also the brand new HKU MTR line extension station that just opened in January 2015, the station is within 5-8 minute walk from the apartment building.
properties.notes: Once you arrive in Hong Kong, everything is quite simple and all starts with a call from the FREE phones at the airport located in the hall immediately after you pass through baggage customs.  There is also a Visitors Center there if you would like to pick up some maps, local travel guides, etc. to read on your way to the apartment.  If you need a local SIM card, there is a 7-11 in the middle section  of the main arrival hall where they see all types of SIM cards, I usually prefer the PCCW brand as it is the larges local operator.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Modern living at the Hong Kong historic Building. North Point ( 北角) is a mixed- urban area in the Eastern District of Hong Kong, between Causeway Bay and Quarry Bay, Parts of North Point have been inhabited since before the British arrived in the mid-19th century. The Metropole Hotel was built in 1899. In 1919 the HongKong Electric Company started operation of the territory's second power station at North Point. In the 1920s, Ming Yuen Amusement Park became a popular entertainment venues on the Island. In 1938, the North Point Refugee Camp was built to accommodate the influx of refugees. The camp comprised 26 huts. Access to the camp was via Kam Hong Road St and Marble Road. During World War II, the camp was renamed the North Point Camp, and used as a prisoner of war camp for captured Canadian soldiers during the Japanese occupation. During the Chinese Civil War, a large number of the rich and middle class from Shanghai fled to Hong Kong many of them settled in North Point. In 1950, No

properties.host_about:
I'm from the Netherlands but I have been living in Hong Kong for the last 18 years. I work as a carpenter/builder/art handler and do projects all over the world. Last year my business partner Marcus and I started a rooftop and playground garden company. Our aim is to improve the life of our students and residents by changing concrete to jungle.
  I like skiing, yoga ( great stretch after a days building...) and baking and eating apple pie and muffins! As for the past... Schooled as a tailor and trained as a carpenter, I have hitch hiked from my village in Holland to Japan, took cargo ships to and from South America, taught English, Dutch and Spanish in Paraguay, tour guided in Patagonia, Bolivia and Chile for 3 years, cycled from Dehli to Hong Kong on Indian bicycles and had some more adventures in between and after.

properties.neighborhood_overview: In a fantastic upscale neighbourhood and a wonderful park just a minute walk from the apartment building.  Another minute walk takes you down to Caine Road and from there,  either take the stairs or escalators down to Central or Sheung Wan within five to eight minutes. You will also pass right through Soho on your way down so it's quite a fantastic visit through the area.
properties.notes: Once you arrive in Hong Kong, everything is quite simple and all starts with a call from the FREE phones at the airport located in the hall immediately after you pass through baggage customs.  There is also a Visitors Center there if you would like to pick up some maps, local travel guides, etc. to read on your way to the apartment.  If you need a local SIM card, there is a 7-11 in the middle section  of the main arrival hall where they see all types of SIM cards, I usually prefer the PCCW brand as it is the larges local operator.
properties.transit: Minibuses and buses stop all along Caine Road (a minute walk away) that will take you to Causewaybay, Central, WanChai and beyond.  Finally, there is a bus stop right across the street from the apartment building that takes you down to Causewaybay through Central as well.
properties.access: Guests have access to: - FREE WiFi - Cable TV - Hair Dryer - Iron/Ironing Board - Microwave, Hot Water Boiler, Cooker - Towels, Sheets, Toilet Paper, Shampoo, Soap, etc.

properties.name: Spacious  flat on Hong Kong Island
properties.summary: Recently renovated flat within easy reach of Sai Yin Pun MTR station. 1 double bed and a very comfortable sofa bed.  Super well equipped kitchen, fantastic internet connection, cable TV and the most comfortable bath you have every soaked in!
properties.space: The flat is on the third floor of a traditional 'tong lau' walk up building. Built in the 50s most have been knocked down and replaced by skyscrapers. This is a rare opportunity to enjoy one of the few remaining traditional colonial era buildings in the Midlevels area.  Most flats in Hong Kong are tiny and cramped with low ceilings but this flat has a super unusual open living dining area and high ceilings. Ideal for entertaining. Perfect for guests who want a bit more space than is usually available.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Convenience - right in the hub of trendy HK, the neighbourhood has hundreds of great restaurants, bars, cafes food stalls, galleries, antique shops, boutiques and fresh produce markets in addition to modern shopping malls and international designer labels. Hiking trails including the 50km Hong Kong trail are a 20 minute walk from the flat. There are 3 supermarkets, a chemist, and dozens of restaurants less than 5 minute's walk from the flat.
properties.notes: You will not be disappointed by this spectacular space, which will enhance any visit to Hong Kong. Remember this is a walk up building without a lift so don't bring too much luggage!
properties.transit: The MTR (metro subway) station is a 5 minute walk. There are bus and tram stops very close by, and taxis are always available. The HK Airport Express Terminal is 5 mins by taxi, and trains to the airport take 24mins, leaving at 10min intervals.

properties.space: This luxury 1 bedroom unit is located in the heart of Hong Kong on a quiet street footsteps to numerous amenities, well known cafes and famous local restaurants. With elevator access this apartment on the 33rd floor showcases a five star interior tailored to fit all of your expectations with a stylish yet cozy setting to make you feel at home. Easy access to MTR/Subway (3 minutes), buses (2 minutes) and trams (2 minutes).  Fully equipped kitchen with built-in stove, full refrigerator & freezer, filtered water tap and a pleasant dining spot.  The bedroom features a comfortable queen sized bed for a single or a couple allowing guests the opportunity unwind after a busy day in Hong Kong.   Also, available is a sizable balcony with great views of the small mountain range as well as panoramic views of Happy Valley, Causeway Bay and Wan Chai. Finally, we have a lovely bathroom with a spacious walk-in shower with a rain faucet which provides a great way to either start or finish the day.  Oth

properties.neighborhood_overview: Perfect for both long and short stay. A neighborhood that allow you to experience Hong Kong as a local. Very convenient location, easily accessible by public transports. You get everything you need daily within few minutes walk. Good mix of urban (shopping malls, commercial complex, restaurants and shops) and nature (trail, park and promenade). Varies bus routes and MTR (metro) that give you easy access to different parts of the city. 5 mins walk to reach Quarry Bay metro station, taking you to different parts of Hong Kong easily. There are also bus routes around taking you to Central, Wanchai, Causeway Bay and Kowloon.
properties.notes: You are responsible for washing and changing the bath towel and bed linens during your stay if you need. There is a laundry shop right next to the building main entrance.
properties.transit: The apartment locates in one of the busiest distracts on Hong Kong Island. Within a very short walking distance you will find supermarket, local market, shopping malls, full range of local/ Asian and western restaurants, bar (one of the best Hong Kong rooftop bars with super nice view is only 10mins walk away), cinema, 24-hour convenient store, clinic, sport center, etc If you enjoy hiking, there is a hike 2 mins away, which is the green view you can see from the guest room window - rare view to find living in Hong Kong. Otherwise have an evening walk / jog in Quarry Bay Park which locates 10 mins away from the apartment. Reaching many of the famous beaches in southern part of Hong Kong in 30-40 mins, there you find also a lot more choices of trail routes.
properties.access: Feel free to use the entire apartment except for the master bedroom.
properties.interaction: I am very happy to give you advices on what you can do in HK, just ask!
properties.house_rules: Female guest only. No smoking in the apartment. Please keep the apartment clean and tidy. No outside guests allowed. I am a vegetarian, cooking and storing of fresh and frozen meat/ seafood are not allowed in the kitchen, while you can heat up pre-cooked non-vegetarian food with oven and microwave.
properties.host_about:
People commonly describe me as a friendly, fun and independent person. I love travelling and spending quality time with friends and like-minded people. 

A vegetarian, an advertising professional, a couch potato who is passionate in cooking.

properties.space: This 1 bedroom apartment is a 2 min walk away from two of the largest shopping centers in Hong Kong: Times Square and the just opened Hysan Place.  All the shopping in the world is yours within these two malls.   The best thing though is the Tang Long Street area where the building is located is still part of older hong kong with absolutely fabulous little local eateries.  If you get tired of the busy city (it does wear you down!), there is also a minibus station steps from the apartment that takes you direct to Stanley market, where you can relax on the sandy beaches and do a bit of shopping at the charming street stalls there, lots of great outdoor restaurants in the area as well. The apartment is equipped with FREE WiFi and basic Cable channels.  There is a full kitchen, microwave, fridge and washer. It's just far enough away to not be noisy at all but great restaurants, shops, sights are all around and situated near all transport (MTR, buses, etc.) This 1 bedroom apartment is a 2 min walk away from two of the largest shopping centers in Hong Kong: Times Square and the just opened Hysan Place.  All the shopping in the world is yours within these two malls.   The best thing though is the Tang Long Street area where the building is located is still part of older hong kong with absolutely fabulous little local eateries.  If you get tired of the busy city (it does wear you down!), there is also a minibus station steps from the apartment that takes you direct to Stanley market, where you can relax on the sandy beaches and do a bit of shopping at the charming street stalls there, lots of great outdoor restaurants in the area as well. The apartment is equipped with FREE WiFi and basic Cable
properties.neighborhood_overview: Perfectly located in the middle of it all, there are world class shopping centres, wonderful eateries, side streets filled with charming local specialty shops, this is Causewaybay and you will not want for more convenience.  The Causweway Bay MTR station is but 2 min walk away and Times Square, Hysan Place, Sogo are some of Hong Kong's biggest shopping centres mere steps from the building.
properties.notes: Once you arrive in Hong Kong, everything is quite simple and all starts with a call from the FREE phones at the airport located in the hall immediately after you pass through baggage customs.  There is also a Visitors Center there if you would like to pick up some maps, local travel guides, etc. to read on your way to the apartment.  If you need a local SIM card, there is a 7-11 in the middle section  of the main arrival hall where they see all types of SIM cards, I usually prefer the PCCW brand as it is the larges local operator.
properties.transit: Buses, Trams and the underground MTR are all within 2 minutes walk from the building, a minibus station near the apartment also takes to scenic Stanley beach, you really can't get much more convenient than this.
properties.access: FREE WiFi TV, Cable, Kitchen,  Towels, Sheets, Toilet Paper, Body Soap, Shampoo, hair dryer.

properties.host_about:
I've enjoyed traveling to different parts of the world my entire life and absolutely love meeting locals at each place I visit to get first hand knowledge of the destination.  I've made many friends across the globe and look forward to visiting them each time I'm back in the region.  I've called Hong Kong my home for the past 30 years, this is absolutely a brilliant little place with so much local flavor and western influences in this Chinese city.  I look forward to meeting lots of overseas friends and pointing out the many local favorites so every visitor has a chance to experience the best of this great city.
Happy travels!
Jason

Des Voeux Road West is quite famous for its dry fish market, that you will find all around the Buidling, but if you walk 3 min you'll be at the waterfront where a beautiful park welcomes you.
properties.notes: There was once a cat living here, so if you are hyper sensitive for cat traces, it can be an issue. Generally we don't have problem with pets, so if you want to bring your 4 legged friend, let us know it should be okay. If you want to smoke, please open the window and sit on the window.  Feel free to use the Kitchen stuff like herbs and spices if you need some. At the minute there is a bamboo Grid around the house.
properties.transit: The Sai Ying Pun MTR Station is 1 min away from the Flat and the Tram and Bus is also only 1 min away. properties.neighborhood_overview: Sai Ying Pun is one of the most interesting, up and coming areas of Hong Kong. Sai Ying Pun has a mix of classic vintage Hong Kong and modern, trendy hipster bars & restaurants. High Street itself is a very popular part of Sai Ying Pun and full of life. Local, traditional lifestyles and new modern metropolitan Hong Kong perfectly emerge together. A whole range of services are lcoated within 3-5 mins walk from High Street - HSBC and other banks are located conveniently on Bonham Rd, as well as more restaurants and supermarkets.  Those looking for some exercise, there is a park close by, you also have Typhoon Crossfit located on Third Street where you will definitely be put   through your paces.
properties.transit: Sai Ying Pun MTR station is only 2 stations (5-7 mins) away from Central Station which is connected to Hong Kong Airport Express station. Bus stop also two minute walk. An affordable taxi ride will take you into Central in 5 minutes, Wan Chai & Causeway Bay in 10-15 minutes. Taxi's usually pass by on High Street frequently, however the best place to get taxi's is either 2nd street (follow the escalator down) or Bonham Rd (follow the escalator up).

properties.space: All eyes gaze on Causeway Bay! It’s where townhouses are grand, streets are gracious, and the Hong Kong high society is looking spliffy – from Jackie Chan to Andy Lau– pass on their way to attending talk-of-the-town soirees. Here, if you’re inclined to go out, you should do so. It’s the see-and-be-seen world. And yet, here on Fashion Walk is a home that may make you forget such glamorous distraction. In fact, you may never even wish to leave. The whole family will revel in this three bedroom apartment with its bracing Victoria Harbour views, but in an apartment which boasts a 60 inch Samsung TV, Hong Kong's famous Laser show every night at 8pm from your very own private sofa, a fully equipped kitchen with maids room, plenty of space in the bedrooms to enjoy privacy... there is much more to do than stand and stare. The jet set Your host, a mother of two, is the very definition of a high-flier. She works for an international luxury homes property estate and travels to many an exotic loca

properties.neighborhood_overview: This enigmatic city of skyscrapers, ancient traditions and heavenly food will fascinate, whether it's your first visit or your 50th. Culture Beyond the glass and steel of Hong Kong’s commercial persona, the city also boasts a vibrant cultural scene that features the eclectic influences of its Chinese roots, colonial connections and a wondrous pool of homegrown talent. Here, you’re just as likely to find yourself applauding at Asia’s top film festival as joining in dawn taichi or reading the couplets of a local poet to the drumbeat of a dragon boat. Culture could also mean indie music under the stars, a classy art walk, your first Cantonese opera – not to mention the exhibitions and events staged year-round at the many museums and concert halls. Why I Love Hong Kong I love Hong Kong because it has a complexity that eludes definition, sometimes even by its own people. I can be soul-searching near the Chinese border, lunching with Sikhs at a Sikh temple, splurging on a set of kitchen kniv
properties.notes: Please note that not every neighbor is happy about the New Sharing Economy. If we want them to understand the 21st century :-)) we should respect normal house rules like.... no party after 10pm, be quiet in the staircase/hallway, don't ring at neighbours bell because you cannot find the key in your handbag, don't throw things out of the window, eg. Just use your common sense.  Although the apartment is on a very high standard and equipped like a serviced apartment - I am still a private host but not a Hotel with fully employed staff and a front desk. Me and my team are always happy to assist - but if can take time to follow your not urgent request (like 1 more towel).

The flat is great as a place to chill, and as a spot to reset before heading back out again. The people and the neighborhood are great. Couples, solo adventurers, business travelers and those just passing through are all welcome.

properties.host_about:
I came to Hong Kong in 2010. I teach English at a school in Sheung Wan, near to central and close to where I live. I travel back to Europe every year to catch up with family, but have done a fair bit of travelling around Asia as well. Outside of Airbnb, my place has served as the pit stop for most people I know looking to add HK to their 'Places I've been' list.

I paint when I can find the time, and read a lot! I've a pretty decent kitchen area in my place, so I've taken to cooking since moving in - but only desserts. 

Having used Airbnb before when I went to NY, I saw what a good host can add to a holiday. But, as with any trip, you kind of want to do things for yourself. So I work to a 'there if you need me, not there if you don't' sort of system, which people seem to like.

properties.neighborhood_overview: I can honestly boast that this is by far the most convenient place to stay ever! Every type of top restaurants are within a block from this location. Din Tai Fung famous dumplings, Fu Shing Dim Sum, Senryo Japanese, Simply Life western fairs, Many coffee shops. There is a block of restaurants and bars down the street and shops surrounding all around including the newly opened H&M flagship store across the street. Victoria Park is a nice serene escape from the city and is only 1 block away. The large Central library is a 7 minute walk away. Electronics, cosmetics, shoes, And clothing, this is a shoppers Paradise. Sogo department store, Hysan Department store, Windsor House, World Trade Centre, Times Square, and Ikea are both 1 block away. There are 3 movie theatres in the area and Times Square,  World Trade Centre, And other landmarks are within a 5 minutes. Easy access by transportation to anywhere in HK. It is a nicer upper class neighborhood and is safe at any time of the day or nigh
properties.notes: This location has access to every part of HK with all the bus lines stopping through, taxi stands, mini busses, and the MTR subway system right below the building. There is a free shuttle to the airport at Park Lane Hotel down the street. It is the only affordable accommodations in Causeway Bay.  Why am I being charged a cleaning fee? Can you remove that? The minimal cleaning fee included in this rental is to cover laundry cleaning for bed sheets, towels and a basic cleaning so please help me not charge an extra cleaning fee for more than ordinary cleaning.
properties.transit: Taxi stand, immediately at the front door to the building.  Mini busses, all bus lines, causeway bay exit E MTR subway station right downstairs. The free airport shuttle is just one block at Park Lane Hotel. There is parking all within a block but, it is pay parking. HK is a city where you don't need a car. It is the most convenient city in the world!

properties.house_rules: There's no pets allowed unfortunately. No smoking inside apartment. Please be quiet, polite and respectful within our apt. If you are going to watch movies/tv shows after 11 PM, please keep the sound at a reasonable level to not disturb the neighbors.  Please do not mention that this is a booking if any security guards ask although Airbnb home rentals are ok they are strict with illegal guesthouses that operate their business daily. We only rent out our place occasionally.

properties.name: 1 bedroom apt in the coolest area on HK Island!
properties.summary: My place is close to the city center and restaurants and dining. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the neighborhood, and the outdoors space. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.
properties.space: My cosy apartment is tucked away in a quiet area of the most up and coming district on the island: Sai Ying Pun. Never underestimate the importance of good sleep in a thriving and vibrant city such as Hong Kong! Just one year ago the MTR station opened in this area and as a result, people are now clambering to live here to make the most of a district which is still strongly Chinese in influence but very much has an international flavour. The expat bubble of Mid Levels is up the hill and the trendy art district, consisting of art galleries, antique markets, curiosity shops and coffee shops, of Sheung Wan is a 5 minutes stroll away. The lifestyles of the local people in Sai Ying Pun is still very much evident with the numerous markets, dried food streets, temples and parks nearby. An easy stroll around the streets will fascinate and intrigue your sights, smells and senses! However, on High Street, Sai Ying Pun, there are plenty of subtle yet international eateries and bars - this is not

properties.house_rules: 1) Please remove your shoes before entering the flat.  2) This is a quiet, residential area so please ensure you are quiet after 10/11pm.  3) Please ensure air con units, hot water switch and lights are switched off before you go out.  4) Ensure the rooftop terrace lights are switched off as the floodlights will keep other neighbours awake otherwise and this may lead to a visit from the police.  5) If you use my internet, you agree to use it only for legal purposes and promise not to use it for illegal uploading, downloading, or other illegal activities. 6) Take good care of the free-standing mirror in the bedroom as it is not hung on the wall and so it could be easily knocked off if you are not careful.  6) Any damages to the property will need to be paid for.
properties.host_about:
I am a single woman from the UK living and working in Hong Kong since March 2015. I work in education, love yoga, try to live a simple life, and enjoy the travel opportunities provided by this amazing island! 

I am a very casual and trusting person who believes in openness, honesty and respect. An avid traveller, I like to explore and much prefer staying in real homes as I feel it helps you to learn more about the culture you are visiting. I hope that if you stay in my home, you will look after my furniture and belongings as if they are yours but also feel comfortable to relax and make the most of your stay in this cool and vibrant area! 

I am always contactable via email but my helper or friend will be around should you need anything remotely. My helper will almost certainly hand over my keys to you and I will leave phone numbers of friends who will be happy to show you around and answer your queries.

properties.summary: Spacious, light & very modern apartment in heart of central.  Quiet and clean location. 800 Sq Ft Sun filled terrace off the living room. Cafe and dinner downstairs, plus 100s of restaurants, bars and gyms within mins walk.
properties.space: I'm travelling at the moment, so have lowered the price to very special level for this period ( have rented for more than double this price). My full time cleaner is in Hong Kong to help with all logistics and cleaning if required. This is an apartment I have spent a great deal of time and effort on and so I'm quite selective on whom I share it with. Please read entire description before you decide whether it is right for you,  it will save everyone time and energy. I am always in and out of the city and have access to another apartment so I can be flexible for  longer stays. But please send me an enquiry first so we can see if it's a good fit. This is a unique apartment in terms of its design, location and huge outdoor space. There isn't another 1 like it.  The finishes are excellent through out, no expense has been spared, there are many original modern design pieces throughout the space, both inside and out. The huge terrace off the living room bathes you in sunlight during the day.

properties.neighborhood_overview: You are literally on the doorsteps of both Soho and LKF in central.    Within a few minutes walk there are more restaurants, bars, cafes, gyms and shops than you can count.
properties.notes: Tons of free closet space for clothes in both bedrooms. The sheets and towels are Egyptian cotton and have there is both down and synthetic duvets during winter. There are air conditioner/heaters throughout the flat. Also there are 2 air purifiers throughout apartment to clean the pollution in the air. Shampoo, conditioner & soap are provided. If it's Sunny day and you want to sit outside we can provide you with the cushions for the seats and your are more than welcome to use BBQ. Huge flatscreen TV & beautiful home theater system for curling up and watching a movie or a favorite TV show.
properties.transit: You are in walking distance to pretty much everything in central Hong Kong.   However,  if you need a bus or taxi you are within a 1 min walk to Wyndham or 3 mins from Queens Rd, 2 of main streets in HK. Central MTR & Airport Express are  5 mins away, while central Ferry & IFC are little more than 10 mins walk.
properties.access: You will have full access to apartment and terrace. While the building does not have any facilities Pure Yoga ( premier Yoga studio in HK ) is next door and there are countless gyms you can drop into, within a few minutes walk.
properties.interaction: I'm usually available to answer all questions and offer suggestions for restaurants, bars or gyms. Also I have full time helper who can be made available if I'm out of town if you need help with anything. My helper can also clean the apartment during your stay for 350 HKD fee.
properties.house_rules: No Pets. No smoking in the apartment. However on the connected terrace is acceptable. No loud music after 11 PM the management will come and or call the police, this has happened before. No parties without prior agreement.  No more than an additional 2 people in the flat without explicit approval, will result in cancellation with no refund. Not for commercial use ( photo shoots, PR Events ect ) without prior approval.
properties.host_about:
Hi, I'm James!
I live and work in Hong Kong now and have been living in Asia for over 12 years now.  I travel frequently for work and for fun like many of you, so I often have my apartment vacant, which is such a shame as I spent so much time and energy working on it.
As you can see from the pictures I'm into modern design and art but also love nature which is is why I love my terrace with all the plants so much.
I guess Ive been travelling my whole life as I was born in the UK but have lived in many different countries over the years.  I've travelled extensively across  Asia as well so if you need any advice or tips on your travels please let me me know.  I truly believe that we travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape us!

properties.neighborhood_overview: The flat is conveniently located on High Street, in up and coming Sai Ying Pun area and within 1 minute from the new Sai Ying Pun MTR (metro) station.  High Street boasts an amazing variety of hip, new restaurants from Chinese diner style to Italian, to a craft beer pub. Go down Centre Street (1 min away) and you get an older, traditional Hong Kong neighbourhood feel of Sai Ying Pun. Sai Ying Pun wet market is just a minute away, where you can get fresh vegetables, meat, fish, and a pretty good cooked food centre is located on the top floor. Go up Centre Street on the escalators and you'll find Bonham Road, the MTR entrance, and more shops and Il Bel Paese, an Italian grocers that will give you your pasta fix and an amazing selection of cheeses and European groceries.  There is an abundance of good restaurants - feel free to ask me for recommendations.
properties.notes: A friend will be responsible for handing over the keys to you, and will also facilitate the pick up.
properties.transit: Busses galore to all parts of Hong Kong if you go down to Queens Road West or Des Voeux Road. MTR station on Second Street or Bonham Road, both 1 minute walk away!
properties.access: There is a second bedroom which serves as an office, which will be locked.   As I live in the flat, I expect guests to respect the space, cleanliness and treat it as if it were their own home - i.e. respectfully and responsibly! The building has a terraced area on 6/f which you are welcome to use outside of school hours (there is an elementary school on floors 1-6, but you wouldn't even know that unless you paid attention as they have separate entrance etc).
properties.interaction: I won't be in town, but am very reachable by mobile, email or better yet, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)/(SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and messenger.  I can always give you tips for Hong Kong, and will have some brochures and maps left out for you.
properties.house_rules: Please keep everything clean and noise to a minimum to respect the neighbours. The apartment is really only suitable for maximum of 2 guests, and that is non-negotiable.  No overnight guests not on the original booking, please! For guests who want separate beds, the living room couch opens up into a very comfortable sofa bed.  If this is needed, please let me know in advance so we can have that set up for you. Any amenities like TV, DVD machine and speakers are there for your use, although of course, I expect it to be left in working condition.  It goes without saying that you shouldn't take any of my things away with you - this includes clothing, accessories, decoration, whatever.   NO pets allowed. NO smoking allowed. NO parties please!

properties.neighborhood_overview: While being on the busy Hong Kong island, North Point is a more local feel and you'll enjoy great food and get to see the local culture. The closest MTR is North Point station which is only 5 to 6 mins walk. Many buses pass by which can take you literally anywhere in Hong Kong.
properties.transit: - Convenient transportation - 5 minutes walk to the MTR (North Point Station or Fortress Hill) - 3 minutes walk to the tramway terminus (Ding Ding) - 3 minutes walk to buses that can bring you to: Stanley, Aberdeen, Kowloon, etc - 2 minutes walk to the taxi stand to Kowloon (one toll charge) So basically, you have the MTR, tramway, buses and taxi nearby. What more can you ask for? Convenient hein?
properties.access: As our guest, you will have access to the kitchen, dining area and bathroom. Basically everywhere but our bedroom. properties.neighborhood_overview: Sheung Wan is a very trendy and lively neighbourhood with lots of cafes and restaurants starting literally right out the door. Our building is located just one block above the main road (Hollywood road) so it is super close to everything and easy to get around but very quiet at the same time. You are over looking the basketball courts (that you can use anytime) and have some green right out the window which is very rare for HK. "Dead End Cafe" right across the street from the building is a really good breakfast place and there is a bakery with some of the best bread in HK at the corner. You can also find some cheap local food a few feet away down the street with a complete noodle or rice meal for HK30! Cleaner in the street, little shops and coffee places, designers boutiques... We are located in between Man Mo Temple (must see if you are visiting HK) and the beautiful HK Museum of Natural Science.
properties.notes: If we are not here when you check in, you just have to get the key from one of our doorman. They are here 24/7 and really friendly. Just give your name and the apartment number and they will help you out.
properties.transit: The Sheung Wan MTR station is a 7min walk or 12 min to Central/Hong Kong Station with the Airport Express. Plenty of buses around as well and taxis right out the door or on Hollywood road.
properties.access: You will be able to enjoy the whole apartment except for 1 bedroom which will be locked.
properties.interaction: If we are around when you check in, we will be more than happy to talk you through the fun things to do and see in the neighbourhood and in HK.  If not, we will leave a handbook for you all info on the apartment and the surroundings!
properties.house_rules: - No smoking in the apartment but balconies ok - Leave the place as you found it  - Take off your shoes inside - Be respectable of the neighbours - Replace what you take from the fride or pantry - Turn off lights when you leave the room, be eco-friendly :)

properties.neighborhood_overview: Made internationally famous by the 1960 film The World of Suzie Wong, historic Wan Chai is not just Hong Kong’s party district; by day it’s a pleasant neighbourhood for wandering and shopping. Dotted along Queen's Road East are a number of excellent rattan and Chinese furniture shops that will happily arrange to have your purchases sent home for you or, for competitively priced clothing, try Spring Garden Lane where stalls offload garments originally earmarked for export. Techies won’t complain about getting lost in the Wanchai Computer Centre on Hennessy Road; a building jam-packed with hardware, software, accessories and other gadgets. And both kids and ‘kidults’ might want to check out Tai Yuen Street; an entire strip of toys touting everything from the latest to the classics.
properties.notes: When you call or SMS or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) to us, please mention the place of (SK7) that you stay. Please respect your surroundings, whether it is the materials that have been provided to make your stay as comfortable as possible or the people in the neighborhood. Most of all enjoy your stay!
properties.transit: There is convenient public transit. From the apartment,  it takes 3 minutes to Wanchai MTR station by walk The ways for the guests getting to our apartment from the airport 1. by airport express, about 30 minutes, about HKD100 2. by A11 bus, about 45-60 minutes, about HKD40 3. by taxi, about 30-40 minutes, HKD250-400 Taxi could stop in front of the lobby of the apartment. No car park.

properties.name: Cosy room besides Victoria Park
properties.summary: I rent out my cosy spare room to anyone that is respectful, clean, responsible and keen to experience Hong Kong in an authentic and unique way. I live a busy and exiting life and happy to take you along my hiking trips or evenings out after work.
properties.space: The provided room has a big fat mattress on which a couple can comfortably sleep. Provided is a shelf with a little soothing aquarium and big cupboards for clothing.
properties.description: I rent out my cosy spare room to anyone that is respectful, clean, responsible and keen to experience Hong Kong in an authentic and unique way. I live a busy and exiting life and happy to take you along my hiking trips or evenings out after work. The provided room has a big fat mattress on which a couple can comfortably sleep. Provided is a shelf with a little soothing aquarium and big cupboards for clothing. Everyone has their own private room and the rest is open to everyone, any time. If you should be a smoker we have a roof top with view on bits of the park and the harbour. I am German and I work for an International Trade company throughout the week. After work I like to hike up peaks for sunsets, go for dinners & special bars, go sailing on weekends, spend time with other international friends I have and take advantage of unique, authentic moments Hong Kong has to offer throughout the week. If my guests wish I am always happy to take them along and show them the city in a way mos
properties.neighborhood_overview: My flat is located on electric road which is flooded with great restaurants, cafés and life style. It is right besides Victoria Harbour with great views, Victoria Park where you can find the best Olympia swimming pool, jogging trial, basketball/tennis/football court and quietness in otherwise busy Hong Kong. Uniquely it is so central yet possible to reach the deep jungles of Hong Kong Island within 15 minutes with stunning not well known bird eye views on the city which I'd be happy to show you.
properties.notes: It's a 2 bedroom flat with a living/dining room, a bathroom and a kitchen on the 3rd floor right besides Victoria park.
properties.transit: I live 2 minutes away from Tin Hau MTR station and a short walk through the park to reach the buzzing causeway bay.
properties.access: Everyone has their own private room and the rest is open to everyone, any time. If you should be a smoker we have a roof top with view on bits of the park and the harbour.
properties.interaction: I am German and I work for an International Trade company throughout the week. After work I like to hike up peaks for sunsets, go for dinners & special bars, go sailing on weekends, spend time with other international friends I have and take advantage of unique, authentic moments Hong Kong has to offer throughout the week. If my guests wish I am always happy to take them along and show them the city in a way most locals don't know.
properties.house_rules: I am looking forward to a respectful, clean and friendly guest. I am not a hotel, more a friend that will care for you. so mutual respect is priority.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Causeway Bay is one of Hong Kong's major shopping districts! There is an abundance of shops, from the 13-storey Japanese department store Sogo and Times Square, an indoor shopping complex, to smaller malls such as World Trade Centre, Windsor House and Hang Lung Centre. With many trendy shops carrying both locally made fashion and products from Japan, Europe and the United States, Causeway Bay is one of the most popular areas in Hong Kong! It is also a popular social area for young people.    Many shops are open until well after midnight! Not only is Causeway Bay a shopping district, but there a range of dining choices, from Asian to Western cuisine! Hong Kong Central Library and Victoria Park is also conveniently located nearby!
properties.transit: Getting around is so convenient as it is close to Times Square, bus stations and the MTR! There are so many choices, from walking, the tram, mini buses, single and double decker buses, the MTR and taxis!  HK public transport is convenient!

properties.neighborhood_overview: This flat is located in the heart of Wan Chai on Ship Street.  The same building also hosts a 3-star Micheline Restaurant (Bo Innovation), and is immediately next to a local heritage conservation site (originally a Pawn Store) which has been restored and turned into a popular restaurant and bar.   Wan Chai is a unique location that provides an appealing mix of traditional and current by combining authentic Hong Kong local culture/architectures with modern western influences. Wan Chai is also extremely convenient with pretty much everything you need within walking distance and in close proximity to most major attractions in Hong Kong!
properties.transit: Supermarket, Drug Store, Convenient Store, Wet Market, Computer Centre, Shopping Mall, Toy Stores, Souvenir Street are all within short walking distance. Major Attractions: 1 min walk to Tram Station and Bus Station 3 min walk to the Wan Chai MTR station (A3 Exit) 4 min walk to Lockhart Road (Famous Red Light District) 5 min walk to Star Street Precinct (another famous area for boutiques and western restaurants) 10 min walk to Bowen road (popular fitness/hiking trail for a walk/jog/run with beautiful sceneries of HK along the way) 12 min walk to Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre 1 MTR stations away from Causeway Bay 2 MTR stations away from Tsim Sha Tsui  5 min ride to Happy Valley Race Course 5 min ride to Peak Tram 7 min ride to Central CBD area / Lan Kwai Fong 10 min ride to Soho 20 min ride to Ocean Park 25 min ride to Stanley 35 min ride to Airport
properties.access: The club house is very unique with a 24hr gym (paid per visit) at one of the top floors of the building overlooking the beautiful Victoria Harbour. At roof top, you'll find a relaxing swimming pool (paid per visit) to enjoy a swim or simply a soak.  There's also a grass lawn and plenty of outdoor coaches, perfect for Yoga or to get a nice tan. The lounge is also opened 24 hours (free of charge) and again overlooking the magnificent Victoria Harbour.  You can simply enjoy a drink there in one of the comfy sofas along with FREE UNLIMITED WIFI access. You may also use the computers located at the business center free of charge.  And in case you need to make some printouts, the lounge staff will also be able to assist (with a small charge).
properties.interaction: I love to meet new friends, so I'll personally check you in/out whenever possible!
properties.house_rules: Key and access card is provided upon check-in.  Charge of HK150/item for replacement if lost.
properties.host_about: My wife and I love traveling and we very much enjoy living the lives of a local at all the places we travel to. Look forward to meeting all of you great hosts and travelers around the world.

properties.description: I rent out my cosy spare room to anyone that is respectful, clean and responsible. Its situated on electric road which has plenty of cafes, restaurants, temples, a museum and life-style to offer. The provided room has cherry wooden floor and a high quality double bed mattress on which a couple can comfortably sleep, two cupboard for plenty storing space. Everyone has their own private room and the rest is open to everyone. If you should be a smoker we have a roof top with view on bits of the park and the harbour. I am German and I work for an International Trade company throughout the week. After work I like to hike up peaks for sunsets, go for dinners, socialise at bars, spend time with other international friends and take advantage of unique, authentic moments Hong Kong has to offer. If my guests wish I am always happy to take them along and show them the city in a way that most locals wouldn't know. My flat is located on electric road which is flooded with great restaurants and life
properties.neighborhood_overview: My flat is located on electric road which is flooded with great restaurants and life style. It is right besides Victoria Harbour with great views, Victoria Park where you can find a swimming pool, jogging trial, basketball/tennis/football court and quietness in otherwise busy Hong Kong. Uniquely it is so central yet possible to reach the deep jungles of Hong Kong Island within 15 minutes with stunning, not well known bird eye views on the city which I'd be happy to show you.
properties.notes: It's a 2 bedroom flat with a living/dining room, a bathroom and a kitchen on the third floor right besides Victoria park.
properties.transit: I live 2 minutes away from Tin Hau MTR station and walking distance (through the park) to the heart of the city.

properties.space: This One Bedroom apartment is conveniently located in Sheung Wan (near Central).  The private rooftop area offers nice city and sea view of Hong Kong and is a great place to wind down after a busy day in the city shopping, eating, meeting, etc. It is tastefully renovated and includes: - FREE WiFi - an open kitchen, electric burner, refrigerator with freezer. - one bedroom with large double bed occupying and one single bed. - large flat screen TV on a wall mount for viewing from the living room, NOW Cable TV, and a DVD player.  - Hair Dryer The apartment is on the 11th floor and has a nice glimpse of the ferries coming into the harbor. The apartment is across the street from the Sun Yat Sun Memorial Park which has an olympic size swimming pool overlooking the Hong Kong harbour and is open to public (entry fee is HKD19 or USD2.5), a beautiful soccer/football pitch, squash courts.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Sheung Wan neighbourhood is ever changing and a fantastic mix of "old' and "new" Hong Kong.  This apartment is located in the heart of Hong Kong's commercial, cultural and shopping districts and within short walking distance to the subway and HK Macau Ferry Pier.  A few minutes walk away from the harbour front and the fantastic Sun Yat Sun Memorial Park and Public swimming pool over look the world famous Victoria Harbor.
properties.notes: Once you arrive in Hong Kong, everything is quite simple and all starts with a call from the FREE phones at the airport located in the hall immediately after you pass through baggage customs.  There is also a Visitors Center there if you would like to pick up some maps, local travel guides, etc. to read on your way to the apartment.  If you need a local SIM card, there is a 7-11 in the middle section  of the main arrival hall where they see all types of SIM cards, I usually prefer the PCCW brand as it is the larges local operator.
properties.transit: Buses, Trams, Minibuses and taxis all run right out side the building all conveniently taking you through Central and all other parts of Hong Kong like Causewaybay, Wan Chai, the exhibition center and beyond.
properties.access: Guests have access to: - FREE WiFi - Cable TV - Hair Dryer - Iron/Ironing Board - Microwave, Hot Water Boiler, Cooker - Towels, Sheets, Toilet Paper, Shampoo, Soap, etc.
properties.interaction: As much as possible or invisible if you want. I will try to meet with arriving guests and show them the area.  Whenever guests need information or recommendations, I am always available via messaging or phone.
properties.house_rules: This is a Strictly NON SMOKING Flat. UPON ARRIVAL AT PROPERTY, ALL GUESTS MUST WAIT FOR ME AT THE FRONT GATE OUTSIDE OF THE BUILDING.  BUILDING RESIDENTS WILL COMPLAIN TO PROPERTY MANAGEMENT IF THE LOBBY AREA INSIDE BUILDING IS BLOCKED.  THANKS FOR YOUR KIND UNDERSTANDING FOR AN ENJOYABLE STAY. Check in time is AFTER 12:30 pm.  Make sure to contact us by phone at least 30 minutes prior to arrival such that we can meet you at the flat to hand you the keys and acquaint you to the surroundings.  As this is a family business, please try your best to arrive at the apartment as early as possible. After 11:30pm as transport to the apartment is limited for us, we have to charge HKD150 to cover our taxi transport cost to and from the apartment. We are generally exhausted at the end of the day and we really would rather you arrive early and not have to charge this. Guests must wait for us OUTSIDE the building upon arrival and not enter the building without us as this causes unnecessary misunders

properties.neighborhood_overview: Say Ying Pun is the new developing district, especially on high street where our flat is.  What is convenient is: - there are plenty of restaurants around (Pizza, Trattoria, Thai, Chinese, Singaporean,Korean, Mexican...) open from breakfast/brunch. - some include bar service though they close at 11pm which gives back the neighbourhood its peace and quietness for the night. - 3 different supermarkets to find either local and western food - 2 min walk on high street to reach the King George Memorial Park & 10 min (down) walk on centre street to reach Sun Yat Sen Memorial Park. - huge local meat,fish and vegetable market (on Centre Street - 1 min walk)
properties.transit: The flat is very conveniently located as :  - 10-15 min walk from central/sheung wan area  - accessible through the brand new  MTR station "Sai Ying Pun" on blue island line.  2 exits very close to the flat : exit B2 and exit C - exit C is the fastest and uses hi-speed elevators.  - plenty of taxi to catch up, especially down the flat, at the very corner of Western Street and High Street.  - many buses and minibuses on Bonham Road and Pok Fu Lam Road (to go to the beaches :) )  - Can walk to the peak from our flat ! (around 1 hour )

properties.neighborhood_overview: Made internationally famous by the 1960 film The World of Suzie Wong, historic Wan Chai is not just Hong Kong’s party district; by day it’s a pleasant neighbourhood for wandering and shopping. Dotted along Queen's Road East are a number of excellent rattan and Chinese furniture shops that will happily arrange to have your purchases sent home for you or, for competitively priced clothing, try Spring Garden Lane where stalls offload garments originally earmarked for export. Techies won’t complain about getting lost in the Wanchai Computer Centre on Hennessy Road; a building jam-packed with hardware, software, accessories and other gadgets. And both kids and ‘kidults’ might want to check out Tai Yuen Street; an entire strip of toys touting everything from the latest to the classics.
properties.notes: When you call or SMS or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) to us, please mention the place of (SK3) that you stay.  Please do not mention you've booked a room online with the doormen or neighbors of the building. If asked please just say you're staying with your friend ERIC (me). Please respect your surroundings, whether it is the materials that have been provided to make your stay as comfortable as possible or the people in the neighborhood. Most of all enjoy your stay!
properties.transit: There is convenient public transit. From the apartment,  it takes 2 minutes to Wanchai MTR station by walk The ways for the guests getting to our apartment from the airport 1. by airport express, about 30 minutes, about HKD100 2. by A11 bus, about 45-60 minutes, about HKD40 3. by taxi, about 30-40 minutes, HKD250-400 Taxi could stop in front of the lobby of the apartment. No car park.
